headline: Live Nation (NYSE:LYV) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q1 Earnings
summary: Live events and entertainment company Live Nation (NYSE:LYV) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 11% year on year to $3.38 billion. Its GAAP loss of $0.32 per share was 17.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Live Nation (NYSE:LYV) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q1 Earnings
raw.summary: Live events and entertainment company Live Nation (NYSE:LYV) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 11% year on year to $3.38 billion. Its GAAP loss of $0.32 per share was 17.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Live Nation posts lower-than-expected first quarter revenue
summary: Ticketmaster-parent Live Nation Entertainment missed Wall Street estimates for first-quarter revenue on Thursday, hurt by higher concert ticket prices amid economic uncertainty. Consumers are reducing discretionary spending due to high inflation and recession fears, affecting demand for entertainment services provided by companies like Live Nation, which are often associated with higher costs. Revenue for the first quarter fell 11% to $3.38 billion, below analysts estimates of $3.50 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: Live Nation Says It Is on Track for Record Summer Concert Season
summary: Its first-quarter revenue beat expectations, and the company says it has sold 95 million tickets so far this year.

headline: Live Nation: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif. AP) — Live Nation Entertainment Inc. LYV) on Thursday reported first-quarter profit of $23.2 million.

headline: Live Nation Entertainment Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
summary: "2025 is shaping up to be a historic year for live music, with a strong start having us on track to deliver double-digit growth in operating income and AOI this year. As more artists tour the world, fan demand is reaching new heights across ticket sales, show attendance, and on-site spending. Ticket sales are pacing well ahead of last year, with deferred revenue for both concerts and ticketing at record levels.
